reviews.review_msg: Probably one of my favourite professors at sfu. He genuinely want his students to do well. He has a few written assignment worth 10% each and mid terms. His lectures are super helpful and recorded. Lots of studying from the textbook and lectures so if you put in the work you will do well. I don't think his classes are curved. Highly recommend Evan

One of my favourite profs, he is caring and provides students with all of the information that they will need. He even provides study guides which are the questions that are on the exams! He provides lecture recordings so you are not stressed if you miss class or cannot catch something in class, and he is accessible and super clear with grading.

This was my 3rd course with Evan and once again he proves why is my fav prof I've had at SFU. Good lectures, always helpful, gives you time to prepare short answers for the exams which are really helpful. Lectures are recorded if you are unable to make it as well. This type of course content isnt easy but Evan made it clear!

Clear lectures +uploads audio recordings of them that you can watch later. Communicates frequently and through canvas/email so you don't have to stress if you miss a class and don't know what was said in it. Lets you know what topics are coming on the exams so there aren't any surprised if you're prepared. also checked in with us on how we're doing
Patrick is super passionate but the topic is very dry. Be prepared to read the text. He gives pretty good study guides that are quite helpful. Don't take this if you're not into Cog Psyc.

Patrick is awesome! The course isn't an easy A though. Put in the work and know your material well. Lectures are actually pretty interesting and he gives really fun examples of different concepts. He let us know the written questions for the final exam so we could prepare. Wish he taught other courses I could take! Also, he's incredibly cute.
He makes his lectures interesting, but his written questions on exams are extremely tough and specific.

To do well in this class, make good notes, ask him questions, and visit your TA's. Stay consistent with the readings, read each lecture slide thoroughly, he likes to issue short answer questions on the smallest of details. For the final read the assigned article, he likes to give short answer questions on that. It is a lengthy read.

Very fun and energetic instructor. Lectures are okay but I think that is the nature of the material. PSYC 325 is heavy with behavorism so if you don't like it it can get very dry sometimes. Kudos to Patrick for jokes and trying to make the dry materials easy to understand. Very easy to talk to.

I LOVED this class. I think Patrick is hilarious, absolutely loved his Starcraft and Pokemon analogy. I found his exams to be super straightforward. If you attend his classes and take really good notes, this class is not hard at all. I honestly don't why people are complaining about him, I thought his teaching style was very clear!

Patrick is a really nice and funny guy. If you keep up with the readings, attend class, and ask him questions when you are confused, you should get a good grade. The tests are a bit tricky though so make sure you know the material well.
Thinks too highly of his teaching ability; places too much emphasis on attendance than conveying information in a fair manner.

He's a young, probably haven't taught a class for a long time (lack of teaching reviews), but he clearly knows what's he's doing.  Attend lecures regularly to avoid missing the iclicker quiz or group discussion (-1% per missing the session). Hard marker (64% D). You better prepared to study real hard to pass or don't take it.

Patrick is an awesome teacher:) Although he is young, may be he needs more practical experience in teaching, but you can feel that he tries his best to make everything more clearer. Moreover, Patrick is accessible for help and very patient, if you have questions, don't hesitate to ask him. Readings are mandatory!!!!please rate your textbook.
Terrible class.

Easily one of the best teachers I have had in my entire academic career. He has such passion for his work and it really came out in his lectures. Im sad that I wont be able to take another class with him again since hes retired.

No doubt he is a brilliant prof, but he is supremely tough on his exams and the people giving him good ratings must be his devoted TAs or lovers that came out of the closet. He teaches a very good life lesson, but getting a good grade requires you to get out of that "norm". Brilliant prof, bad marking scheme.

Intelligence and enthusiastic prof with a high status in his field. Open to critiques and always there to help. Although course materials is intense with challenging exams requiring lots of efforts, in my 4 yrs in university this is the only course that i can remember all the materials well even after a year without any rehearsal. Thanks, Bruce!
horrible lectres. he has very messy writing and isnt able to properly communicate ideas.stay away.unfair marking scheme of exams, but TA is helpful
Class was very very difficult. The average grade on exams is a c. Do not take this course unless you have to!

This class is not hard if you study the right way. I'm pretty sure that the ppl whining on here got bad marks, otherwise, his exams DO have EVERYTHING to do with what you learn in class, you just have to study the right way. This a memory course, and he teaches u IN CLASS how to study for the exams, pay attention! This class was an easy A for me :)

This was officially the very first class I've ever failed. Exams were so confusing that I feel bad for even trying. I wanted to drop this course originally but couldn't so I suggest to all of you that If you had a choice, DO NOT TAKE THIS COURSE. Nice guy and all, but a complete GPA killer. Class averages are always a C or lower so lookout!

No textbook and weird exams. He was a nice-enough guy but the topic was extremely boring. It was his weird exams that turned me off the topic forever. Can't even describe it here. Only take this course if you have to. Taking this course made me decide to switch from a major to a minor. If you have to take it for credit, good luck.
If you don't have to take this class then don't! The material is easy to understand BUT his exams are impossible! He tricks you and his marking scheme is VERY unfair!
The material is very interesting and very useful but the exams do not adequately measure how much you actually know. Test averages are in the 60's or lower so make sure u do well on the assignments.

I liked the material for this class, but it was not an easy grade. Tests were ridiculous, he purposefully tries to trick you- so you're not actually being tested on the material, but on how well you can decipher his questions.

Not as bad as it's sometimes made out to be. The way I got an A+: explain the ENTIRE course to someone who is not taking it. It may be really boring but it will be worth it as it helps you clarify things. It takes 2 1/2-3 hrs per exam.

This class was quite challenging. There is no text book so basically the exams come straight from the lecture materials. Go over your notes and make sure you CLEARLY understand EVERYTHING. Lots of trick questions, thats why its important to learn every little detial.Tip-study right after each lecture,just 2hrs worth of stuff so its not that bad.
FINALLY!!!  A professor that has something interesting to say!  Really great course and REALLY interesting prof who lectures like he's telling a story!
Quite straightforward, only need to take few days before the exams to review the lectures and notes, you will get pretty good mark.

This class was great. Whittlesea is not always loved by everyone because yes,he does have a dull voice that is monotone,but if you keep up with what he is talking about,this class is so straightforward.Assignments in labs are a give-away 30%.If you enjoy cog psyc,take this class! if not, avoid it then.Class is based solely on research in the field.
No Comments
No Comments

He said to me (1994) that he teaches to the top 10% of the class, and that he knows that the rest of the students don't follow him.  He seems to have a pretty elitist approach to university education.  He may have gotten better.

I don't know what the hell you guys are talking about.  I got an A in this course.  It's very straightfoward..basic memorization.  You don't even have to take notes in the class.  All the notes are provided online and you just memorize that.  Just pretend this is a history course and you'll do fine.

His lectures are pretty straightforward with lots of analogies to help understanding.  Not great at clarifying things though, but his TAs are excellent at that.  Exams are tough, but if you study adequately, they're do-able.
Interesting lectures, but the exams are ridiculous.

very knowledgable. m/c part of the exams is super difficult, so watch out for the wording & if it makes sense within the context of the question.  do NOT study the night before the exam unless you want to fail!! TAs help a lot so ask questions.
Prof is very intense - covers material very quickly.  TA's help alot.  Though exams are tough, you learn alot in this course.  And the stuff you learn can actually be used in every day life!

Most brilliant course ever taken.  The man is a genius.  Very well planned lectures, tells an amazingly interesting story.  Major player in the field, and understands it better than anyone else.  Smokes cigarettes fiendishly.
Challenging course but if you pay enough attention and are willing to spend some time on his notes, you will at least earn a B+.  I won't say he's a difficult prof, he just has a different style.
Touch, challenging, but you learn quite a bit. If he's also your TA, he'll makes things nice 'n clear during tutorials if you ask questions.
learn alot if listen to lectureTape >10x;  isn't chatty except re: his resear
although he's a kind person, he's unclear, and disorganized.

She is one of the best prof I have ever had. She is so passionate in this course and she knows a lot about everything. Even though the material is not easy, but i absolutely enjoyed the course. She is very helpful and everything was very organized. If you are interested in memory, you wouldnt wanna miss this course.

Dr. Barha knew what she was talking about but often spoke too fast and went through the slides too fast. The text for this class was difficult to read and unfortunately a lot of exam questions were taken from it.  Read the text AND read the slides in order to do well.

The classes were heavy but thats just the nature of the course. Dr. Kent explained concepts very well and had clear expectations for assignments. The way she spoke about the material shows she's obviously very passionate, which made each lecture very engaging. Just be sure you allot enough time to study for exams.
PSYC 325 was a more difficult course than I was expecting. Brianne's lectures were well organized and engaging but the material was not easy and the exams were very challenging in my experience.

The exams were non sensical and did not test much on the content of the textbook or papers that we were required to read. So you'll spend a lot of time studying for things you won't be tested on. Her midterm and final questions are based on random studies from the lecture that seem unimportant. I feel defeated trying to get a good grade lmao

Dr. Kent is very kind and a good lecturer. First few lectures are a little boring because she has to go over basics, but once she gets into the later lectures you can tell that she's very passionate, which makes for engaging classes. Tests are pretty hard, but fair. Pay attention to graphs and pictures on slides as they are tested often.

This prof is so kind and seems like she cares a lot about student. I didn't enjoy this course content as it was a lot of animal studies but she made it easy to do well. Exams aren't cumulative and purely on the notes so you don't even need to look at the textbook at all. Group project was annoying but overall easy outline to do well in the course

Always listens to student feedback and cares for students. The course has multiple components (midterm, final, group projects, etc.) but they are almost evenly weighed. There is lots of material so she could sometimes go a bit fast, but she's always open to questions whenever.

Dr. Kent is a really good prof, TBH she is one of the best profs that I had at SFU. She cares about her students, she is not a tough grader, her exams are fair, and she teaches well. The only thing I did not like was that she sometimes can speak very fast, which makes it hard to learn the concepts (considering that PSYC 325 is a heavy course).

She is a very caring prof and always listens to all feedback from her students and wants to make this course as easy and accessible as possible. I do find the pace of lecture to be quite fast even with typing my notes and she does read off of slides mostly (which isn't a big deal IMO). This course is very bio heavy btw so just be weary of that

Mario is the cutest little man in the entire world. Just saying. His lectures are unfortunately a little dry, but he does try to spice things up by adding jokes. My advice would be to read the textbook more than anything, and read over lecture notes. This class was easy and FAIR. Know your stuff and you will get an A no problem.

Uses the slides that come with the textbook and reads them word for word. He's not interested in the subject and is teaching it due to university request only. Exams are from the test bank, but he rewords the short answer questions, which are very open ended and marked rather harshly. The quizzes come straight from the practice questions online.
Just don't take the class.. tests are extremely difficult and he is so hard to understand. gpa will go down

All around great guy and great prof. You'll do well on the MC if you study the text, and the written questions are from his lectures. Quizzes are ridiculously easy. I would take any course Dr. Liotti teaches!
Be warned! His multiple choice questions are as easy (class avg 88%), but written questions are as hard/trick as they get (class avg 51%). Be prepaid for very unbalanced exams!
One of the best profs~~!! highly recommended!! Also quite easy as long as you read the text book you will be good for the course.

Seems like a nice guy but unfortunately, he is probably one of the worst profs I've encountered. His accent throws me off big time. He can never finish a sentence explaining concepts without simply reading from the slides that I doubt is even his. He always just gives up trying to explain something in the middle of a sentence and moves on.
If you like a prof who is vague, disorganized and does things last minute, then broesch is the one for you. Otherwise, avoid.

Dr. S is a very thoughtful professor. I took her classes for both PSYC 325 and PSYC 382 in the same semester. Her classes are quite heavy - there are a lot of practice assignments (small marks), 3 tests, 1 final project and 1 final exam. Though course material can be challenging at times, Dr. S is SUPERB at explaining concepts.

She is very nice and provides study guides, however, essentially everything she teaches is on it so it's useless. Her exams are quite difficult and it's not clear what should be known. Time is very limited, her exams are basically all short/long answers. When all her students informed her we were extremely rushed she told all of us to learn more.

Lesley created a very organized remote learning environment. Her test structure was challenging to adjust to at first, and she does assign a few "homework" tasks for small % but they were great for practice and grade boosts. Her lectures/notes were easy to follow and led to seamless studying with provided study guides. She explained concepts great!

I took PSYC325 with Dr. Schimanski during covid and I really enjoyed her course structure as well as how she teaches! Lectures were split up into 5-20min videos discussing each concept so it was easier take in information. You can tell she loves teaching and comes up with fun assignments to learn the material! 10/10 recommend taking a class w/ her

DR.S is great, her course is laid out in a very easy way online, the assignments are made to be interesting- The course focuses on behaviour processes and brain substrates of each chapter which can go into further understanding in the textbook. The material seems intimidating but it's not that bad. Dr.S lays it all out in a way that makes sense.

Dr. Schimanski is a great professor. She is extremely approachable, super nice, and explains concepts clearly. Exams are straight from the notes so if you memorize them you will do great. Definitely take any class she teaches.

Great professor. Very nice and cares about her students a lot. The course was really interesting and exams mostly come from the lectures. The textbook is only good for better understanding and a few study guide questions.

Attendance isn't mandatory w/c is a good thing bec. he is SO BORING. He is nice and helpful but i just fall asleep in class. 1st midterm everyone did bad so for the finals he gave us a 150 pg pdf of the things we need to study and the long question bec there were 9 chapters in the most boring book we would've had to read. Lecture isn't recorded.
exams are unfair, most of the class failed. Don't take it unless you are prepared to memorize 500 slides word for word for his fill in the blanks.
